title: can the feature of enabling native resolution be added?
body: this game forces super resolution to be turned on, is there any way to turn off super-resolution to experience true native game graphics?
author: ziojacky

comments.body: Turn the super resolution slider to 100% and the game renders in native resolution.

title: Can't launch the game with error "Failed to open descriptor file ../../../b1/b1.uproject"
body: Doing a full re-install first and will update the ticket.
author: vincent-lu

comments.body: Heh, I was about to say that it sounded like a game problem and to try verifying game files in Steam.
Redownloaded the game, problem solved. Weird.

title: Developer Console crashes game? (In new update)
body: In the new update the game crashes, and I think the cause is developer console being turned ON. Turning it off (false) stopped the game from crashing.
author: Wobbledongle101

comments.body: I can confirm its the console, setting `[Developer Console]` to false fixed the crashing at startup for me as well
Is this crashing still happening with v0.8.4?

> Is this crashing still happening with v0.8.4?


Seems to be fixed, just updated from 0.8.2_test to 0.8.4

title: Game Science Update Breaks Ultrawide Fix, Causes Main Menu Crashes
body: Game Science has recently released an update for the game v**1.0.8.14860,** which has caused the ultrawide fix to stop functioning. As a result, the game now crashes to the desktop when attempting to access the main menu.
author: VintageGenetics

comments.body: Same issue here. After the update, I had to remove the fix to be able to play it.

The crash is related to enabling the developer console. To fix it for now, disable the option in `WukongTweak.ini`

```ini 
[Developer Console]
; Enable developer console. 
; If the console does not open, check the README or "WukongTweak.log" for info on how to enable it.
Enabled = false
```

title: I have tested with 16:10 screen display, it works!
body: Thank you so much for your MOD, though FOV is a bit narrower
author: DoubleTrust

comments.body: What number for FOV is good? I read some guy said in the guide that 120 FOV is good.

I need to test it tonight. Using this MOD only will make FOV narrower a bit. Need another tool to make it broader @therocketpunch
